title: (37002) Salamanca - 0 Calle Cristóbal Riesco
description: Self-service laundry with low prices washing

title: (37005) Salamanca - 20 Calle Alfonso de Castro
description: Self-service laundry, open from 8am to 10pm. Two 12kg washing machines. A 16kg washing machine. Two 16kg dryers. Cash exchange box available. The machines only accept €1 coins.

title: (37001) Salamanca - 4 Plaza Ángel
description: Laundry really cheap! 4 euros the 14kg and 6 euros the 19kg. 2euros the 16 minutes of drying. Close to the Plaza Mayor.

title: (37003) Salamanca - 3 Calle Peñaranda
description: Free parking 10 minutes walk from the Plaza Mayor, large parking lots, with some unevenness but without major importance, no noise at night, safe and clean.

title: (37004) Salamanca - 34 Avenida de los Cedros
description: Self-service laundry in the Garrido neighborhood

title: (37003) Salamanca - 21 Calle Bilbao
description: Large gravel parking lot, there are no signs that you are not allowed to stay overnight. great for a night and to visit the city.

title: (37005) Salamanca - C. El Bierzo
description: Carrefour supermarket parking lot. We parked, stayed  peacefully and everything was normal.

title: (37003) Salamanca - 1 Calle Nueva Guinea
description: Parking places across the road covered by tall trees.  They are marked with white lines meaning it is free. Good place to visit the city center.

title: (37006) Salamanca - 31 Calle El Bierzo
description: Laundry with bathrooms, near Carrefour supermarket.

title: (37003) Salamanca - 1 Calle de Jesús Arambarri
description: Large free public car park with no height limitation but prohibited for people over 3.5 tonnes. 20 minutes from the Plaza Mayor on foot. A bit noisy at night with traffic but quiet night without a problem.

title: (37003) Salamanca -
description: Laundry Self-service Colada Jamaica

title: (37005) Salamanca - 136 Avenida de San Agustín
description: Peaceful place. parking of a pavilion and close to another pavilion schools, institutes and parks. without services. 20 minutes walk to the city center

title: (37004) Salamanca - 1T Calle Lázaro Ralero
description: Very large parking lot, behind the multipurpose Sánchez Paraíso, at the door of the Montessori school. With very long parking spaces, bus size. 50m from the Los Cipreses shopping center and very close to the highway exit. At night absolute silence except for a passing car. We were there during the week, on weekends we would have to confirm. Good for a stopover to sleep en route and have a meal in the shopping center where there is also a Gadis macro-supermarket.

title: (37008) Salamanca - 13 Calle Teso de Calle San Nicolás
title_short: (37008) Salamanca - 13 Calle Teso de Calle San Nicolás
description: Parking for camper or small motorhome. No prohibition sign. Found by chance. We spent 1 very quiet night, in silence, in the middle of Holy Week. Quiet hidden street, little space, walking from the center and services.

address.street: 13 Calle Teso de Calle San Nicolás

title: (37008) Salamanca - 50 Paseo de San Gregorio
description: Unlimited Parking on the Road for small campers. Place is for standard car.

title: (37008) Salamanca - 44 Calle Huertas
description: Parking ten minutes from the cathedral of Salamanca... very calm and quiet place... there are lots of places around the area to parking on the street outside.

title: (37003) Salamanca - 2 Calle Molino Contrafuerte
description: Quiet day and night parking, 15 min walk from the center of Salamanca. Access by a small tunnel at the end of the roundabout limited to 3m in height. Ok for vans. Twenty seats. Quiet night after a visit to Salamanca sangrias and tapas. A train passed around 3am and a few walkers with their dogs in the morning. Top place.

title: (37008) Salamanca - 54 Calle Cordel de Merinas
description: Small street with several free parking spaces. No prohibition, no height limit. With a 6m van it is good but not bigger. For smaller vans it is better. Close to a large playground for children and walks along the river. Access to the historic center in 10 minutes. Perfect for visiting the city and spending the night in peace.

title: (37007) Salamanca - 5 Calle Sector 45
description: Free public parking, fairly level, small spaces

title: (37006) Salamanca - s/n Avenida de Portugal
description: 15 minutes from the cathedral

title: (37008) Salamanca - N-630
description: PISTAS DEPORTIVAS UNIVERSITARIAS "SALAS BAJAS". The car park is 500 meters from Plaza Mayor. Next to the city center which is beautiful, we stayed for one night, free, a little noisy though.

title: (37900) Santa Marta de Tormes - 26 Paseo Parque Fluvial
title_short: (37900) Santa Marta de Tormes - 26 Paseo Parque Fluvial
description: Calm place next to the river. It's a street parking but the street is little used. Free parking and plenty of space.

title: (37008) Salamanca - Via Helmántica
description: Parking day and night without service about 25 places very sought because at some distance from the old city; arrived if possible before 17h or late because mixed with the VL during the day; superb position to visit on foot and walk along the water

title: (37008) Salamanca - 36-38 Carretera Fregeneda

title: (37008) Salamanca - 4 Calle Saavedra y Fajardo

title: (37193) Cabrerizos - Camino del Rio

dead end street without any traffic. Opposite Lidl. Good starting point to get to the city center by bike (via Isla del Soto)
Illuminated at night, all around free areas without buildings. We felt very safe.

address.street: Prol. de Av. de la Serna

title_short: (37188) Santa Marta de Tormes - 3 Calle Sector Ur

It's just perfect for shopping while you wait. Probably closed outside of 9 a.m. to 10 p.m. and on Sundays.

title: (37007) - 5D Sc Marin I
description: Spot où on doit pouvoir rester là nuit pour ceux qui souhaitent visiter Salamanca. calme et éloigné des habitations. A 3,6 kms de Salamanca.

title_short: (37198) Carbajosa de la Sagrada - 21 Calle Juan de Herrera

Can stay overnight is by a road so not quiet but probably quieter than the aire.  Not really walking distance to town (we moved to the lidl (east side of town) and town was about 15 /20 min walk from there.)

It is good for a stop to eat and shower, on the way along the silver route. I would not stay to sleep because the area does not give me confidence.

title: (37193) Cabrerizos - 13 Calle Arroyos

title_short: (37184) Villares de la Reina - 155 Carretera la Mata
description: Very quiet town where you can sleep 1 night without problems to make a stop on the way to Cádiz.

title: (37193) Cabrerizos - 43 Diseminado Carretera Aldealengua
description: Plenty of level paved parking with capacity for 5 motorhomes, which is accessed by an unpaved road in good condition. Next to the Tormes River, with access road and picnic trails.

title: (37184) Villares de la Reina - 11 Calle Su.E1
title_short: (37184) Villares de la Reina - 11 Calle Su.E1
description: Land wasteland next to the sports area. Quiet area to spend the night, partially illuminated and very close to the center. A few meters away there is a pizzeria, very good pizzas.

title: (37184) Villares de la Reina - 160 Carretera la Mata
title_short: (37184) Villares de la Reina - 160 Carretera la Mata
description: Quiet place to spend the night. In the small town there is a gas station, bars (with good snacks and sandwiches), a pizzeria 100m away, swimming pools, pharmacy, bakeries and supermarkets. Also commissioner of Civil Guard. Around the sports area there are good places to spend the night. Water fountain in nearby park.

name: Camping Regio
title: (37900) Camping Regio
description: Camping Regio in Santa Marta de Tormes near Salamanca. The bus leaves from the neighboring hotel and drops off in the center of Salamanca. 1 bus every hour. Count 2 days of visit. Many locations on often grassy and shady ground. Narrow access for tall and long campers. It must be possible to stay in the very wide central aisle.

name: Camping Don Quijote.
title: (37193) Camping Don Quijote.
description: The campsite is ideally located to visit Salamanca by bike, along the river, about 35 minutes. The camper pitches are spacious and in the summer the trees provide enough shade. The owners are 2 young sisters who recently took over the business from their parents. Good English speaking and VERY helpful and thoughtful. You can see in everything that there is a feminine touch. The terrace has been made cozy and now covered with transparent igloos for this somewhat colder period. The sanitary facilities are clean and neatly maintained. And very special, a rain shower, without a coin or push button. I can certainly recommend this campsite.

title: (37193) Cabrerizos - 14 Diseminado Arenal del Ángel
description: It is a large open space in front of the entrance to the Arenal del Angel river park, a few meters from the river and surrounded by trees. I stopped there. Prohibition signs.

title: (37193) Cabrerizos - 65 Camino Aceña
description: Isolated parking spaces offering a magnificent view of the valley. Close to houses but little traffic, we stayed there the night and had no problem. Small supermarket in the city accessible on foot (15min).

title: (37189) Aldeaseca de la Armuña - 35 Calle Ruta de la Plata
title_short: (37189) Aldeaseca de la Armuña - 35 Calle Ruta de la Plata
description: Quiet place to sleep there are shops bars a gas station and buses to Salamanca

name: AreaPark Salamanca
title: (37129) AreaPark Salamanca
description: Private area just 5 minutes from Salamanca, taxi service, you can cycle through the golf course past the Doña Brígida Spa, with all the services and tranquility. Washing machine, Showers Showers and light included. Town 10 minutes walk where you can find pharmacies, supermarket, bars, lottery, stalled....

title: (37185) Villamayor - Camino Canto
description: Place to put the truck for the night by the river. Nothing fancy but it does for one night before heading back.

title: (37439) Castellanos de Moriscos - 43 Calle de Cabrerizos
title_short: (37439) Castellanos de Moriscos - 43 Calle de Cabrerizos

title: (37430) Moriscos - 2 Calle Zamora

title_short: (37191) Calvarrasa de Arriba - Avenida de la Peña

title: (37796) Arapiles - A-66

title: (37796) Arapiles, Castile and León - DSA- 106
description: Site of historical interest, located 500 meters from the town of Arapiles, in the area between the two mountains where the "Battle of Arapiles" was fought. With an Interpretation Center in the town. Cyclable Greenway between Salamanca and Alba de Tormes along the old Ruta de la Plata route. Artisanal bakery in the village.

title: (37796) Arapiles - Carretera Ruta de la Plata
title_short: (37796) Arapiles - Carretera Ruta de la Plata
description: To relax. Parallel parking space for smaller womos or vans on a deserted street. 3 star hotel with parking nearby. Little traffic.

title: (37190) Terradillos - 7 Paseo Poniente
description:
Area with gray water dump only. Black water next to the water intake, next to the road.
The clean water faucet is broken.
Greywater discharge is uphill, so it all ends up anywhere but the sewer

title: (37882) Terradillos - CL-510
description: Quiet area and out of sight, close enough to the road so you can hear the cars a little. There is something to settle in several places along the way.

title: (37797) Calzada de Valdunciel -

title: (37449) Galindo y Perahuy - 21 Nacional Burgos a Portugal
title_short: (37449) Galindo y Perahuy - 21 Nacional Burgos a Portugal
description: Motorway area where it is possible to land, refuel and take a shower (no time limit). Very friendly staff, you can also spend the night there even though it's close to the highway and there are a lot of trucks.

name: Camping Olimpia
title: (37427) Camping Olimpia
description:
Pedrosillo el Ralo, Carretera Pedrosillo.
Campsite Olympia. Stop for one night, friendly welcome boss speaks French service station opposite. Very pleasant welcome. Very good stopover on the road to Portugal before Salamanca. Very good homemade catering offered for a menu without drinks. We recommend it for a temporary stopover
I would add that the boss is very commercial and super friendly. Very good home cooking.

title: (37427) Pedrosillo el Ralo - Carretera A-62, km 225
title_short: (37427) Pedrosillo el Ralo - Carretera A-62, km 225
description: Service area, you can have a shower

title: (37893) Salamanca - A-50
description: Cepsa gas station Showers, bathrooms, bar with food for tapas.

title: (37427) Pedrosillo el Ralo - 20 Calle Abajo
description: Very nice and quiet place to stay on the outskirts of the village with a view of a small lake. Picnic areas, water and garbage cans available. Good connection to the motorway.

title: (37882) El Pinar de Alba -
description: Pretty meadow, calm night assured. You have to slalom between the trees to get there. The referencing is done in 4x4 but a van can do it too.

title: (37893) Nuevo Francos - 16 Calle Alameda
description: Very quiet area to be able to rest near the highway with a minimum detour, with barbecue, tables and drinking water. Right next to it is a bar-restaurant where you can have breakfast, lunch or dinner, highly recommended, where you can request any need such as showers, electricity, firewood... they can help you with whatever you need.

title: (37336) Huerta -

Large space, near the river. In the shade of the trees.
Very quiet more than the motorhome area next door.

title: (37336) Huerta - 15 Calle Paseo del Tormes
description: Quiet place with picnic tables, trash cans and stadium toilets (can be opened outside covid, they were closed in May 2021). small refreshment bar and stroll along the river. I think it is possible to spend the night there

title: (37336) Huerta - 20 Paseo del Tormes
description: Parking for motorhomes with permission to stay overnight. It has a terminal to discharge gray and black water. It also has a tap for drinking water. The area is located next to the river Tormes, near different beach bars, picnic areas, river beach, recreational areas ... Different services are offered in the town: grocery store, pharmacy, mechanical workshop ... THAT THE ONLY OBJECTIVE IS TO ENJOY AND REPEAT. THANK YOU SO MUCH.

title: (37170) Zarapicos - 142 DSA-504

title: (37789) Buenavista - 149 Urbanizacion Cuatro Calzadas
description: A parking lot next to a large restaurant where you can eat deliciously. As the car park is a few 100 m from the national road, it is very quiet at night.

title: (37789) Buenavista - 12 Urbanizacion Cuatro Calzadas

title: (37428) Pajares de la Laguna - 35 Calle la Armuña
title_short: (37428) Pajares de la Laguna - 35 Calle la Armuña
description: Approximately 400m after the motorway exit on the left. Great to stay the night in case the car breaks down!

title: (37183) Morille - 9 Carretera Monterrubio
description: Private and fenced land, integrated in the town. We have drinking water, electricity, grey/black water drainage and a SWIMMING POOL in the summer season. You can also savor the products of the garden that is located on the same plot. We have an area with artificial grass, a pergola with an outdoor terrace to enjoy the good weather and thus a better stay for visitors. In the town there are two bars/restaurants and several museums that you can visit. We are 15 MINUTES from Salamanca and with exit to the Ruta de la Plata highway in 20 minutes, by road where you can see the Salamanca meadow and the Charro Field.

title: (37183) Morille -
description: Art Cemetery, where you can observe the various tombs and inscriptions. Unique!!!!!!

title: (37800) Alba de Tormes - 14 Calle Cementerio
description: Quiet parking Next to the cemetery and near the river to fish. It is next to the village De Alba de tormes. The ideal is a motorhome.

title: (37800) Alba de Tormes - 18 Avenida Juan Pablo II
title_short: (37800) Alba de Tormes - 18 Avenida Juan Pablo II

title: (37800) Alba de Tormes - 2 Calle Castillo
description: Laundry- Self-service, large parking area, washing and drying in less than 1 hour. Economic, quality, results, do not accumulate clothes if you are on the road, enjoy your time !!? Vending machine inside coffee, snack, soft drinks, water, sweets ..... We use the best products in each wash, disinfects after washing. Come visit us !!

title: (37800) Alba de Tormes - 20 Avenida Juan Pablo II
title_short: (37800) Alba de Tormes - 20 Avenida Juan Pablo II
description: Flat parking between the village and the campsite which were closed at the time we passed. Excellent restaurant named Almeda 400 meters by the small path to the football stadium.

title: (37115) Juzbado - 68 Calle Damas
description: Recreational area of ​​Juzbado, located next to the river Tormes. The area has a playground, barbecues, tables, drinking water tap, football field. Lots of shade There is a gate in the area that has been put to prevent cattle from entering and although it is closed, you can access its interior without a problem. Public swimming pool and courts within a kilometer, bars, geological museum in the village and public library. Routes for hiking and mountain biking. The town hall is very dynamic and promotes many activities.

title: (37800) Alba de Tormes - C. Camping
description: Picnic area next to river beach

title: (37115) Juzbado - 22 Calle Río Tormes
description: Parking of the municipal swimming pools, in summer season it will not be possible but the rest of the year it is a good place to park and spend the night, quiet and level, a picturesque place for its paintings.

title: (37170) Golpejas - 1T Calle la Iglesia
description: Drinking water. You can park right next to it. Also WIFI4EU works well in this spot if needed!

title: (37448) Calzada de Don Diego - 27 Calle de la Ronda
title_short: (37448) Calzada de Don Diego - 27 Calle de la Ronda

title: (37337) Moríñigo - Unnamed Road
description: Wooded area, with parking and the possibility of overnight stays for all types of vehicles, plenty of shade, benches, barbecue, garbage cans and drinking water.

title: (37451) Matilla de los Caños del Río - Camino Canillas de Arriba
title_short: (37451) Matilla de los Caños del Río - Camino Canillas de Arriba

title: (37428) La Orbada - Autovía de Castilla

title: (37429) Aldeanueva de Figueroa -

title: (37419) Parada de Rubiales - 29 Calle Despeñadero

The passages are too narrow and the streets not wide enough. They have a source of drinking water next to the fronton. Very quiet place to stay en route, a few kilometers from the highway.

title: (37799) -

title_short: (49430) Villaescusa - Cam. de la Calzada de Salamanca

title: (37789) Fresno Alhándiga - 372 N-630
description: The large concrete parking lot of a small Repsol station, the young man in charge of the pump speaks French. Also a small cafe. The gas station has toilets and shower service until 23:00 for €2.50

title: (37100) Ledesma - 6 Carretera Villarino

description: Motorhome area that looks new as it did not exist marked on park4night. Space for gray water and black water, filled with water (tap without normal connection). Area and eco-sanitary point for the exclusive use of motorhomes.

title: (37100) Ledesma - 23 Calle Tenerías
description: Very beautiful place in the middle of nature, calm and shaded by the water. Accessible for any vehicle. No sign of prohibition or limitation of height.  No service, but near village.

title: (37100) Ledesma - 22D Calle Tenerías
description: Very beautiful spot at the water close to the Ledesma village. A little more private than the other close spot at the bar. No services.

title: (37100) Ledesma - Calle Tenerías
description: Quiet place next to the Tormes river with beautiful views of Ledesma. Sound of cowbells. People fishing. If you are not afraid of darkness and loneliness is perfect.

title: (37100) Ledesma - Calle Tenerías
description: Peaceful area next to a local park and picnic area. Accessible by a good track ( from the west) Can’t access from the other place on this website because stones block the track. Lots of space, flat.

title: (37100) Ledesma -
description: Wide area on the banks of the river, access by dirt track, good access, quiet area, nearby picnic area.

title: (37100) Ledesma -
description: Quiet area next to the Tormes river with wonderful views of Ledesma. fisherman's corner. perfect for crayfish fishing

title: (49710) El Cubo de Tierra del Vino -
title_short: (49710) El Cubo de Tierra del Vino -
description: Small area of land in the shade of a tree 100 meters from a gas station. We stopped here to eat because there was no service area for many kilometers.

address.city: El Cubo de Tierra del Vino

title: (49440) Cañizal - 4 Diseminado Diseminados
description: Near the highway. A little further is a gas station. We spent a quiet night here. Simple and functional. You're standing right now. Okay for one night. Enough space.

title: (37795) Montejo - DSA-135
description: Restaurant parking with showers. Good service.

title: (37795) Montejo - DSA-135
description: Parking under the trees, flat, along the edge of the lake and the road going to the dam, quiet, perfect for a meal break or night before taking over the autovia

title: (37795) Montejo - DSA-135
description: Superb location overlooking the dam, no amenities but endless place for fishing and swimming.

title: (37795) Montejo - DSA-135
description: Surrounded by nature, good for fishing, cycling, walking. Peaceful location on the banks of a large dam, parking is across the dam wall,  access is via a narrow road best navigated by day.

title: (37795) Montejo - Unnamed Road
description: Next to the swamp, practically flat, very quiet, right now we are here spending the night and zero noises beyond those produced by the environment itself. close to the a-66 but no cars can be heard. by the Cepsa gas station exit.

title: (37795) Montejo - Unnamed Road
description: At the lake, splendid view, access by road, for a small camper ... No noise ... Only happiness ...

title: (37795) Montejo - Unnamed Road
description: Beautiful location by the lake, with a view of the mountains in the distance, I spent a weekend here without problems, very quiet, on Sunday a few walkers, I'm not sure that by motorhome access is possible, a few passages difficult on the way, I went through with a 6m van, no services

title: (37310) Macotera - 19 Carretera Piedrahita
description: Public parking in the municipal swimming pools. Typical town of Salamanca. Mudejar route. Right next door is the pool bar. Inside showers and toilet in good condition. Although it is next to the highway it is very quiet to sleep, it has little night traffic. The town has free wifi from the town hall

title: (37785) Galinduste - 15 Carretera de Armenteros
description: If you are on the Ruta de la Plata and you need a water change or just to rest, come to us. We have a large plot with a platform for the evacuation of gray and black water. In the town you will find shops selling very good salami and ham, a pharmacy, a bar and a swimming pool in summer. Let us know before your arrival to make sure we are there to receive you

title: (37787) Pelayos - Unnamed Road
description: We spent the night here without any problems. It is very quiet and easily accessible. The road is dirt but easily passable. Great vantage point for sunset and waking up

title: (49410) Fuentelapeña - ZA-602
description: Beautiful location at the end of the village near the football field, with picnic area and barbecue very quiet night.

title: (37460) Garcirrey - CV-107
description: Good parking next to a fairly unpaved road. Have spent a night here. Peaceful area. Good reachable by camper.

title: (37114) Villaseco de los Gamitos - 25 Calle Humilladero
title_short: (37114) Villaseco de los Gamitos - 25 Calle Humilladero
description: quiet parking

title: (49177) Alfaraz de Sayago - 1 Plaza Mayor
description: Quiet place to spend the night with garbage containers.

title: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Camino de Vadillo de la Guareña
title_short: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Camino de Vadillo de la Guareña
description: Castrillo de la Guareña has a motorhome area belonging to the Ruta Raia Norte (the first cross-border motorhome route in Europe). The area has picnic areas and a playground. It has 10 parking spaces and an eco-sanitary services platform for these vehicles, Wi-Fi connection and 24-hour surveillance. Avoid the area from August 8 to 12, due to patron saint festivities and possible noise.

address.street: Camino de Vadillo de la Guareña

title: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Unnamed Road
title_short: (49419) Castrillo de la Guareña - Unnamed Road
description: Wonderfully shady place under pine trees, ideal for a break or siesta

title: (49706) Corrales del Vino - Autovía Ruta de la Plata
title_short: (49706) Corrales del Vino - Autovía Ruta de la Plata
description: rest area on the edge of the highway towards Extremadura. very ample parking in battery and in line for long vehicles. It has 3 picnic areas in the sun but there are separate trees to set up your own table in the shade

title: (37779) Salvatierra de Tormes - Unnamed Road
description: In September laid by the lake for one night. Nice sunset. Calm. Starry sky.

title: (37779) La Tala - Unnamed Road
description: Had a quiet night here with no problems. Access only possible with an off-road vehicle.

title: (37779) Salvatierra de Tormes - 3 Calle San Juan
title_short: (37779) Salvatierra de Tormes - 3 Calle San Juan
description: Free parking at the foot of the castle. Village of 75 inhabitants with history. Spectacular view of the lake. Good restaurant at the rural hotel.

title: (37779) Salvatierra de Tormes - 16 Calle Villarejo
description: A charming town with very few inhabitants. We spent one night, a quiet place, without noise and with spectacular views. We had dinner and breakfast at the Rural Hotel where they were super friendly. The views of the Santa Teresa reservoir make the place a very beautiful place.

title: (37779) Aldeavieja de Tormes - 1 Camino Cementerio
description: Next to the Santa Teresa Reservoir. Wooded area, wide, next to the Reservoir. Without any service, but very close to the town of Aldeavieja de Tormes

title: (37779) Aldeavieja de Tormes - Unnamed road
description: On the edge of a magnificent lake, no service, but a magnificent place for the night or the day with the possibility of swimming.

title: (37779) Aldeavieja de Tormes - Unnamed Road
description: Another possibility to land on the edge of the water reservoir. It's not quite flat. No shade, often wind.

title: (37753) Armenteros - 32 Camino Tala
description: Drinking water

title: (49700) Corrales del Vino - 2 Calle María Paz Ortega
title_short: (49700) Corrales del Vino - 2 Calle María Paz Ortega
description: New motorhome parking with all free services except light that does not only have lighting but not to hook up or recharge, you can park and spend the night next to the municipal pool, walking a maximum of 5 minutes to the entire urban area with pharmacy, shop, bars, etc…

title: (37779) Aldeavieja de Tormes -
description: Nice place right next to the lake. The pitch offers shade from the side and shelter from strong winds due to the low trees. wThis keeps it from getting too hot and the PV can still generate electricity. It's very lonely at the site as most drive to the nearby picnic area. Overnight stays accepted and maximum 2-3 cars per day (08/19 on a Saturday). Also very easy to get to. Note: Do not use the first driveway, as the driveway here is very steep and you will definitely land (unless you are off-road). Use the second entrance and keep left (see maps; very easy to spot). For longer vehicles it could be a little sloping. My vehicle: 7m longer and 3m high (long wheelbase). Please take your paces or similar with you and leave the place clean!

title: (37779) Aldeavieja de Tormes - Camino de La Aceña
title_short: (37779) Aldeavieja de Tormes - Camino de La Aceña
description: Entry of the dirt road, with 7,5 meters motorhome with Portamotos, the site is at the edge of the lake, beautiful, calm and if you like nature, it is worth despite the road

title: (37770) Guijuelo - A-66
description: Picnic area, without shade.

title: (37770) Guijuelo - 2 Calle I
description: We have only stopped to eat, but it is a quiet place and you could sleep without problem.

title: (37770) Guijuelo - 2 Calle Rio Huebra
description: Quiet place for several campers nearby. Edge of an industrial estate. Beautiful view of the mountains.

title: (37770) Guijuelo - N-630
description: Iberfuel gas station, in the industrial area, with cheap diesel.

title: (37770) Guijuelo - 21 Calle Teso de la Feria
title_short: (37770) Guijuelo - 21 Calle Teso de la Feria
description: Quiet place to spend the day. Flat and without services.

title: (37768) Fuenterroble de Salvatierra - SA-212
description: This is a very weird place! It is the beginnings of an industrial estate but there are no buildings yet so it is completely empty and deserted. It has nice views and is useful if you want a quiet place to have a snooze. No shade, no water and not beautiful but has a function!

title: (49155) La Bóveda de Toro - 19A Calle Guareña
title_short: (49155) La Bóveda de Toro - 19A Calle Guareña
description: Good place, water, calm, filling and emptying

title: (37770) Guijuelo - 4 SA-104
description: Parking at the edge of a lake, located in the middle of a bend in a road with few passages. Ideal for a stopover, possibility of spending the night there. Very nice view of the lake.

title: (49154) El Pego - Cañada de Venialbo o Vereda Zamorana
title_short: (49154) El Pego - Cañada de Venialbo o Vereda Zamorana
description: Small forested area. rare in this land of fields. little wooden cabin. not a lot of level ground but good for camping.

address.street: Cañada de Venialbo o Vereda Zamorana

title: (37770) Guijuelo - 6d Calle Bajada de las Piscinas
title_short: (37770) Guijuelo - 6d Calle Bajada de las Piscinas
description: Large parking lot at the sports center, very quiet night, the truck parking lot scared us for waking up

title: (37770) Guijuelo - 2 Calle Filiberto Villalobos
description: Parking trucks but they allow you to park without problems, monitored 24h. And bar for breakfast a good toast with good ham at a good price.

title: (49153) Venialbo - 16 Camino Villalazán
description: A firm sand/grass parking area near a children's play area with BBQ available. Village is a few minutes walk with bars, supermarket, bread shop. Ancient bridge and church also of interest.

title: (37774) Guijo de Ávila - Unnamed Road
description: Parking spot. total calm. wonderful starry sky. right in front of a no longer existing campsite.

title: (37760) Linares de Riofrío - 27 Calle Cerca
description: Quiet parking, in slope, essential shims. ideal to know the Sierra de Las Quilamas, climb the peak Cervero, and the forest of La Honfria. Lovely in autumn

title: (37768) Los Santos - 62 Calle Sierra de Francia
title_short: (37768) Los Santos - 62 Calle Sierra de Francia
description: Quiet parking in an area between Sierra de Bejar and Sierra de Gata. Visit theme park and taste hornazos and cheap Iberian products

title: (37760) Linares de Riofrío - Unnamed Road
description: Pitcher Fountain. Place where you can replenish water, there are also a couple of tables

title: (49720) El Perdigón - 1 Camino Bodegas
description: Private parking of Bodega Los Yugos. The owner, a very friendly man, allows parking. Next to it are the bar toilets. But the best is its food, its underground cellar and the little town lost in the middle of nowhere but only 5km from Zamora.

title: (37760) Linares de Riofrío - Unnamed Road
description: Very peaceful, with tables, bbq area and water ( only a dribble when we went in April. ) you could probably spend the night but the ground is sloping gently.

title: (49152) Sanzoles -
description: Since June 2019, Sanzoles has a Motorhome area belonging to the Ruta Raia Norte (the first cross-border motorhome route in Europe). It is located in an area with picnic areas, next to sports courts and the Wine Interpretation Center. The Area has up to 10 parking spaces and a platform for eco-sanitary services for these vehicles, Wi-Fi connection and 24-hour surveillance.

title: (37773) La Cabeza de Béjar - 10 Calle San Roque
title_short: (37773) La Cabeza de Béjar - 10 Calle San Roque
description: Very quiet town. The ground is of earth. It is next to a very beautiful Chapel. There is a pylon where you can catch water. You can drink without problems. Ideal to spend the night. In front is the village bar and a playground

title: (37773) La Cabeza de Béjar - DSA-170
description: Roadside, little passage ideal for one night.

title: (37740) Santibáñez de Béjar - 11 Barrio Cabezuelo
description: Parking high area of the town. Possible to park and spend the night. There is a bar nearby and the town has grocery stores, drugstore, bakery.
